text:
- My name's Jamie and
I'm a UX Designer at AWS.
I work on the browser team, Amazon Silk,
which is the browser for Fire Tablet,
Fire TV, and Echo Show.
We're really interested
in delivering the best web experience

or the best browsing
experience for customers.

So we do a lot of
exploratory feature work.

When I first got to Silk
and first got to AWS,

one of the things I noticed
was that on tablets,

Amazon Retail was displaying
in the desktop format.
And that seemed odd to me because
they're essentially large mobile devices.
And so one of the first things that I did

as an initiative that I
was keen on driving was

to test showing the mobile
layout versus the desktop.
And that ended up having a massive impact
to the retail experience.

So that was really cool because
it's sort of a small change,
but the impact was massive.
One thing that stands out,

continues to stand out
is our customer focus.
So we work backwards from the customer,

and that is at the forefront
of our decision making.
That's something that I've found
in my professional career to be unique.
I mean, there's a lot to love, right?
There's a lot about the culture
that really resonates with me.
And I remember in my interview
about five and a half years ago,

really feeling a strong
connection when I got into campus,
when I started talking to people.

I just felt like the culture
was the right fit for me.
And I know that sounds kind of cheesy,
but I really feel like I belong here.
(upbeat music)
